faqSection.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
faqSection.subheading: All You Need to Know When You Buy House in Gurgaon

faqs.q: What are the best sectors to buy house in Gurgaon for investment?
faqs.a: Sectors along the Dwarka Expressway, Golf Course Extension Road, and New Gurgaon sectors like 82 and 83 offer excellent appreciation potential due to upcoming infrastructure projects and planned developments.

faqs.q: Is it better to buy an independent house or a villa in Gurgaon?
faqs.a: It depends on your needs. Independent houses often offer customization and land ownership, while villas usually come with community amenities, professional maintenance, and better security features.

faqs.q: What documents are essential when purchasing a house in Gurgaon?
faqs.a: Essential documents include the Sale Deed, Occupancy Certificate (OC), Completion Certificate (CC), mutation records, and previous sale agreements to ensure clear and marketable title.

faqs.q: How much Stamp Duty is applicable for property registration in Gurgaon?
faqs.a: Stamp duty charges usually range between 5% and 7% of the property value in Haryana, depending on gender and urban/rural location, plus additional registration fees.

faqs.q: Can foreigners buy residential property in Gurgaon?
faqs.a: Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) and Persons of Indian Origin (PIOs) can generally buy immovable property in India, excluding agricultural land, plantation property, or farmhouses.

faqs.q: What is the typical process for buying a resale house in Gurgaon?
faqs.a: The process involves searching for property, token payment, extensive legal due diligence, home loan application, execution of the Agreement to Sell, final payment, and registration of the Sale Deed.

faqs.q: How can I check the RERA status of a project before I buy house in Gurgaon?
faqs.a: You must verify the project and developer registration details on the Haryana Real Estate Regulatory Authority (HRERA) official website to ensure compliance and transparency.

faqs.q: Are there hidden costs involved when buying a property?
faqs.a: Yes, buyers should account for costs beyond the base price, such as brokerage fees, GST on under-construction properties, maintenance charges, utility connection fees, and interior modification costs.

faqs.q: Which areas offer the best connectivity to Delhi?
faqs.a: Areas closer to the Delhi-Gurgaon Expressway and metro line extension, such as DLF Phases, Cyber City, and sectors connecting directly to NH48, offer superior connectivity.

faqs.q: What kind of loan assistance do you provide?
faqs.a: We connect buyers with leading banks and financial institutions, helping them navigate the complex home loan application process and secure favorable interest rates tailored to their purchase.
